org.jpws.pwslib.data

Class PwsFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecordList
      • org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<PwsRecord>

    public class PwsFile
extends PwsRecordList
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Top level structure of this library to represent a Password Safe (PWS) database file. It is both a container for a set of PwsRecord and a device to communicate the persistent state with external media.

    This class is an extension of a record list (PwsRecordList), hence data of all records are kept in memory, eventually causing restrictions on the amount of records that can be kept during a program session. This class deals with all definitions required to represent, create or handle a "persistent state" (encrypted PWS file) of a record list on an external medium. In addition to the record list, it allows to define a set of up to 255 "header fields" which are data elements on a list generic level. Just as with PwsRecordList, the methods of this class are not synchronised.

    Persistent State

    The persistent state is defined, in the sense of all required parameters for an IO-operation, by a quadruple: i) the IO-context (application adapter), ii) the filename (filepath), iii) the access passphrase, and iv) the file format version. It is ensured that there are always valid settings for application adapter and file format. The default adapter is Global.getStandardApplication() .

    Using ApplicationAdapter interface is a fairly abstract conception to access peripheral media and allows to adapt the services of this class to any user context. The full definition of a persistent state is however not mandatory to use an instance of PwsFile.

    File IO:

    Persistent states (external file data) are accessed through data streams which are made available by application adapters. The handling of file-IO and data formatting is done by class PwsFileFactory. To obtain an instance of this class from its persistent state, use the static methods of class PwsFileFactory or the loadFile() method of this class. To create a persistent state use the save() or saveCopy() methods of this class when all required parameters for the persistent state are available. If a loaded file was of a different format version, or some indication of potential data loss occurred during loading, the next save will make an attempt to preserve the existing file by adding a name extension ".old".

    File Formats

    This class now supports reading and writing of all three historical, major file format versions of Password Safe. The following policy is adopted concerning these formats. Files loaded from a persistent state feature the format version of the persistent state. New instances (not loaded) feature the latest available format version. File saving produces an output format version as currently set in the PwsFile object. At any time the user can modify the file format setting of an instance without restrictions. Downgrading a file version may, however, result in loss of record data that is not supported in the older format.

    Header Fields

    Since PWS format version 3 a facility for up to 255 data fields, each of free length and type, is supported by PwsFile. This is a handy way of making file generic information available which may be application specific. Through getHeaderFields() the user gets hold of a HeaderFieldList containing elements of type PwsRawField. This list can be mined for and manipulated with data; however it will only be stored on a persistent state in file format V3. There are several reserved data fields defined by PWS and JPWS. The user of this library should not define proprietary fields in the range 0x00 .. 0x7F.

    User Options:

    User options take the form of a text string and are now stored as an element of the header field list (field-ID is PwsFileHeaderV3.JPWS_OPTIONS_TYPE). These options are reflected both into V3 and V2 files. For V2 files options also may contain the PasswordSafe Preferences (special options of the program PWS); for V3 files PWS Preferences are stored in a special header field and may be accessed by field-ID PwsFileHeaderV3.PWS_PREFS_TYPE.

    Universal Encoding:

    As of file format version V3 all text data is stored in universal encoding UTF-8. Previous formats may also refer to the current JVM default encoding.

    See Also:
    PwsFileFactory, ApplicationAdapter

    • Constructor Detail

      • PwsFile

        public PwsFile()
        Constructs a new, empty PWS database for the standard IO-context (by default the local file system). This file has a void definition of the persistent state; filepath and passphrase have to be set up before this file can be saved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no global standard application is available

      • PwsFile

        public PwsFile(DefaultRecordWrapper[] recs)
        throws DuplicateEntryException
        Constructs a new PWS database with an initial record content as represented by the parameter record wrapper array. Duplicate records in the array lead to an exception thrown; no check for record validity is performed.

        The resulting instance has no persistent state definition and no passphrase assigned!

        Parameters:
        recs - array of DefaultRecordWrapper objects; may be null
        Throws:
        DuplicateEntryException

        The resulting instance has no persistent state definition and no passphrase assigned!

      • getCharset

        public java.lang.String getCharset()
        Returns the activated character set used to encode text strings on the persistent state. (The charset is "Utf-8" for V3 file format (fixum) or for V2 format if "B 24 1" is present in user options. It is the VM default character set otherwise.)
        Returns:
        String charset name

      • setFormatVersion

        public void setFormatVersion(int value)
        Sets the format version number for this file. The value determines the technical file format of the persistent state of this file. If the value is out of range, the latest format version is assumed.
        Parameters:
        value - int file format version (use one of the values defined in class Global) or 0 for latest format

      • getBlockedDataSize

        public long getBlockedDataSize(int format)
        Returns the size of the data block required to store the content of this database on a persistent state. (This takes into respect the general file formating rules of a PWS file of the specified format.) This is a relatively expensive operation as it walks through analysing all records with each call.
        Parameters:
        format - int file format version of the projected persistent state
        Returns:
        long required (blocked) data size

      • save

        public void save()
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 ApplicationFailureException
        Writes this file to its persistent state in the linked IO-context. This method requires that the persistent state of this file is fully defined. After successful operation, the MODIFIED flag is reset to false. This method does nothing if the MODIFIED flag is found to be false.

        The persistent state of a file is defined by application adapter, filepath and access passphrase.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the required parameters for the persistent state are not set up
        java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurs
        ApplicationFailureException - if the IO-context fails to render an output stream

      • write

        public void write(java.io.OutputStream output)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a persistent state of this file to the given output stream. There is no reset of the MODIFIED flag after execution.
        Parameters:
        output - OutputStream
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the encryption passphrase is not set up
        java.io.IOException - if an IO-exception occurs
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if output is null

      • read

        public static PwsFile read(java.io.InputStream input,
                           PwsPassphrase ps)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           PasswordSafeException
        Reads and renders a PwsFile from an input data stream.
        Parameters:
        input - InputStream
        ps - PwsPassphrase encryption key
        Returns:
        PwsFile
        Throws:
        InvalidPassphraseException - if the given passphrase is false
        PasswordSafeException
        java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occcurs
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any parameter is null

      • saveCopy

        public UUID saveCopy(ContextFile targetFile)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     ApplicationFailureException
        Writes a copy of this file to the specified file of the specified medium, applying the same passphrase as is defined for this file. The copy will own a different UUID identifier.
        Parameters:
        app - ApplicationAdapter the application context in which the target file will be created; if null then the same application is referred to as is defined for this file
        filepath - String the file name specification for the target file
        Returns:
        UUID the file identifier value of the copy or null if unavailable
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filepath or the file passphrase are not defined
        java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurs
        ApplicationFailureException - if the IO-context fails to render an output stream

      • saveCopy

        public UUID saveCopy(ContextFile targetFile,
                     PwsPassphrase pass)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     ApplicationFailureException
        Writes a copy of this file to the specified file of the specified medium, allowing to setup a different access passphrase for the copy. The copy will own a different UUID identifier.
        Parameters:
        targetFile - ContextFile file specification for the copy target
        pass - PwsPassphrase an optional passphrase for the copy; if null the passphrase of this file is used
        Returns:
        UUID the file identifier value of the copy or null if unavailable
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filepath or the file passphrase are not defined
        java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurs
        ApplicationFailureException - if the IO-context fails to render an output stream

      • saveCopy

        public UUID saveCopy(ContextFile targetFile,
                     PwsPassphrase pass,
                     int format,
                     UUID fileUUID)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     ApplicationFailureException
        Writes a copy of this file to the specified file of the specified medium, allowing to setup a different passphrase and a different file format version for the copy.
        Parameters:
        targetFile - ContextFile file specification for the copy target
        pass - PwsPassphrase an optional passphrase for the copy; if null the passphrase of this file is used
        format - int the target file format version or 0 for this file's format setting
        fileUUID - UUID if not null the copy will assume this UUID value, otherwise keep the existing UUID; V3 only
        Returns:
        UUID the file identifier value of the saved file or null if unavailable
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filepath or the passphrase are not defined
        java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurs
        ApplicationFailureException - if the IO-context fails to render an output stream

        Parameters:

      • getUserOptions

        public java.lang.String getUserOptions()
        Returns a text String with file specific options set by the user.

        The policy of this value is the following: for format V2 files it represents the same data field that is also used by PasswordSafe (PWS). For format V3 it represents a JPWS specific data field. The PWS specific preferences of a V3 file can be obtained by getHeaderFields().getField(PwsFileHeaderV3.PWS_PREFS_TYPE).getString("utf-8"). V1 format does not support an option string.

        Returns:
        String with user options; empty string if undefined

      • setUserOptions

        public void setUserOptions(java.lang.String options)
        Sets the user options for this file.

        Note concerning the persistent state: For V2 files this will set the PWS preferences header field. For V3 files it will set a JPWS specific field (which is not an element of the PWS canon). The PWS preferences (String x) of a V3 file can be set by getHeaderFields().setField(new PwsRawField(PwsFileHeaderV3.PWS_PREFS_TYPE,x.getBytes("utf-8"))). V1 format does not support an option string.

        Parameters:
        options - String, may be null to clear an assignment

      • setPassphrase

        public void setPassphrase(PwsPassphrase userpass)
        Sets the user passphrase for the encryption of this file (access passphrase).There are no controls on the quality of the passphrase value used. The empty passphrase is allowed.
        Parameters:
        userpass - PwsPassphrase, the access passphrase to be used on persistent states. Use null to clear

      • hasResource

        public boolean hasResource()
        Whether there exists a complete persistent file definition for this instance.
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if there is an application adapter and a filepath defined

      • equalResource

        public boolean equalResource(PwsFile file)
        Whether this file has the same persistent resource as the parameter file.
        Parameters:
        file - PwsFile file to compare
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if file is not null and both compare objects have either no or identical persistent files

      • getSourceFormat

        public int getSourceFormat()
        The file format number of the data source from which this file was read in, or 0 if this file was not read in.
        Returns:
        int file format version

      • getHeaderFields

        public HeaderFieldList getHeaderFields()
        Returns the operational header field list of this file. Use the returned object to perform your header field operations. (This list is always present but will be saved to a persistent state only in file format version V3.)
        Returns:
        HeaderFieldList

      • getRecentUsedEntries

        public java.lang.String getRecentUsedEntries()
        Returns a list of recently used entries, represented by their serialised UUID values (32 hex char), separated by a ";" char or null if this value is not available.
        Returns:
        String or null

      • setRecentUsedEntries

        public void setRecentUsedEntries(java.lang.String value)
        Sets the header field for "Recently Used Entries" after a programmatic formatting using 32 char hex serialised UUID values for each entry, separated by a ";" char in the list.
        Parameters:
        value - String formatted UUID list (may be null)

      • setHeaderFields

        public void setHeaderFields(HeaderFieldList list)
        Method to replace all existing header fields of this file with the fields of the parameter list. Does nothing if list is null.
        Parameters:
        list - HeaderFieldList, may be null

      • setChecksumResult

        protected void setChecksumResult(boolean ok)
        Sets the checksum verification status. (This is normally only applicable for a V3 file.)
        Parameters:
        ok - boolean result of the checksum verification

      • isChecksumVerified

        public boolean isChecksumVerified()
        Whether the checksum of this file has been set to "verified OK". (True by default)
        Returns:
        boolean true == checksum verified

      • setSecurityLoops

        public void setSecurityLoops(int loops)
        Sets the amount of security calculation loops valid for the access shield of this database. The parameter value will be corrected to assume a minimum of 2048 and maximum of 4194304. (The property "SecurityLoops" is only meaningful for V3 files.)
        Parameters:
        loops - int amount of calculation loops

      • getSecurityLoops

        public int getSecurityLoops()
        Returns the amount of security calculation loops valid for the access shield of this database. (The property "SecurityLoops" is only meaningful for V3 files.)
        Returns:
        int security loops

      • getSignature

        public byte[] getSignature()
        Renders a content signature value for this PWS file. Returns a SHA-256 checksum which is the sum-up of all its records' signatures plus all its header field values.

        It may not be assumed that this value is identical over different releases of this software package, however it is expected to be identical over different program sessions running the same package.

        Overrides:
        getSignature in class PwsRecordList
        Returns:
        byte[] 32 byte signature value (SHA-256 digest)

      • getDataSignature

        public byte[] getDataSignature()
        Renders a data content signature value for this PWS file. "Data content" is defined as the ordered set of records contained in this file. Returns a SHA-256 checksum which is the sum-up of all records' signatures.

        It may not be assumed that this value is identical over different releases of this software package, however, it is expected to be identical over different program sessions running the same package.

        Returns:
        byte[] 32 byte signature value (SHA-256 digest)

      • getDatabaseName

        public java.lang.String getDatabaseName()
        Returns the logical database name if it is defined, null otherwise. This name is an element of the file's header fields.
        Returns:
        logical database name or null if undefined

      • loadFile

        public static PwsFile loadFile(java.io.File file,
                               PwsPassphrase passphrase)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               PasswordSafeException
        Loads a PWS file of any format from the local file system. For other sets of parameters see the PwsFileFactory class!
        Parameters:
        file - File file to open
        passphrase - PwsPassphrase file access passphrase
        Returns:
        the opened, fully operable PwsFile object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any parameter is null
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the specified file was not found or access was denied
        InvalidPassphraseException - if file access could not be verified
        PasswordSafeException - if a file format error occurs
        java.io.IOException - if an IO-error occurred

      • getTimeStamp

        public long getTimeStamp()
        Returns the time-stamp for the external data state of this file. This is a procedural datum and not element of the stored file. PWSLIB sets this value when a file instance is loaded from or saved to the external state.
        Returns:
        long time

      • setTimeStamp

        public void setTimeStamp(long timeStamp)
